skillTree.localised_description: Cadavo's current steed is an ill-tempered gelding only loyal and tending to Cadavo. To those few he doesn't kick on sight, he answers to the name of Broccolo.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Cadavo has survived multiple military campaigns, an undefined number of duels, at least five magical armageddons and six mothers-in-law.
Cadavo will have his city. The fat toad will probably get tired of destroying it way before Cadavo is of trying.
You may not like it, but this is what peak performance looks like.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is with one of nature's tricks that Cadavo created one Duke Arrenault's hardship. It was El Cadavo, still in Tilea, that originally happened to destroy Rodrigo Delmonte's lands, which in turn prompted the latter to start what ended up as the Alcatani Fellowship. In one of the company's campaigns, it was Duke Arrenault's turn to fall in the dust, losing his knights, his feud and his eye to the Tilean pikes. A fallen knight by fate and attitude, Arrenault goes renegade in search for the tools for vengeance.

effects.description: The Alcatani Fellowship will never fight for this Legendary Lord

skillTree.localised_description: Arrenault is in Estalia, trying to gather what men and resources he can against the Alcatani and their masters. He is out of luck until he is mistaken for the famous El Cadavo, whose successful persona he promptly abuses to lead what turns out being an overseas expedition. Arrenault ends up in the New World, growing into the figure of a ruthless mercenary commander, accruing a large retinue of adventurers and even other disillusioned Bretonnians. Almost as he reckoned his resources to be enough for his vendetta, the real Cadavo, also in the New World, gets wind of the impostor. El Cadavo and Arrenault start a slithery game of hunted and hunter until their forces collide under a showering monsoon. The battle is fierce and chaotic, yet the two leaders finally manage to meet each other in a fierce and one-eyed duel in the undergrowth. In the exhausted silence of a dying battle, a fateful pistol shot rings among the rain sprays.

Renegades, adventurers and mercenaries stop fighting as one, as the monsoon also stops its apparently tireless attempt at turning the place into a swamp. A couple of minutes later, Cadavo emerges from the jungle, bloodied yet satisfied, for the challenger is dead, head caved in by the bullet. He raises Arrenault's crest, the trophy upon which he scratches his victory mark, as the survivors from both armies cheer the victor, for this is how things often go among such fighters. He adds the crest to the lot of other charms and trophies he carries, and reassembles his troops for whatever the future awaits.

Only a few of the defeated are killed: there aren't many other ways to get rid of troublemakers so far away from provisions and what passes as civilization. And yet the survivors' hearts are high, because even if the day was bloody and wet, the pay is going to be excellent, the future looks bright for they are the best troops ever assembled in the Colonies, under a legendary Condottiero that has just defeated an upstart rival and that now only intends to restock and start what promises to be a fruitful adventure in a ripe land.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: That he would lead the greatest adventuring army ever assembled, that he would trample any opposition in this New World and in the Old World. That he would never forget his past and learn from it, for the future challenges will likely demand each grain of his ability.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Enables Lance Formation for melee cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: That he is El Cadavo, the greatest mercenary commander to ever exist, a rock against the ebbs and tides of the ruthless world, and that he will be just as merciless for the world is his for the taking, and for anybody who would follow him to glory.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: A Duke was just another notch on Cadavo's blades, just another scar on his face. The figure of Cadavo was born in the heat of politics and battle, had matured in incredible stories and then into myth. The clever would notice that Cadavo's stories are centuries old, scattered in space and time and yet mostly true. Someone whispers that he is immortal, that his is only a title, that he cannot just be a mercenary commander. Be that as it may, Arrenault's apparent demise will just fuel Cadavo's legend and add another paragraph to fireside stories.

effects.description: Income from sacking and looting settlements: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Myrmidia, if not a member outright. Myrmidia is an ascended mortal and the chief deity in the south, and the vast influence of her cults teach tactical acumen, mercy, and civilization.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Nahmud, if not a member outright. Although part of the vaster Myrmidian cults, the various sects of Nahmud favour equality and special education, and are somewhat too fond of secrecy.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Sister Fury, if not a member outright. One of Myrmidia's companions in life, Fury's legacy is one of intense, violent, but controlled rage and violence against injustice and destruction.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Solkan, if not a member outright. The merciless god is one of the most ancient, and just as timeless is his unbridled retribution against the corrupted. His is currently a relatively awkward presence, strongest in Remas.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Morr, if not a member outright. The old god of the dead's legacy is one of fatalism and certainty, and finds its largest seat in Luccini.

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: -10%
	(enemy armies in local region)
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Shallya, if not a member outright. Her teachings of healing and compassion feel at odds with the world's grimness and darkness, which is also why many flock to her.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Verena, if not a member outright. Like her husband Morr, the blind deity's legacy is not only one of learning and justice, but also one of detached impartiality.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Ranald, if not a member outright. He is one of many and sometimes darker aspects, but the lord of fortune was also the only one who could make Morr smile. Somewhat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Grants one of the listed effects at random

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, its not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, its not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
It doesn't matter if they have gambling issues or if their perception of property is somewhat challenged. These men are the best fighters around Cadavo.

skillTree.localised_description: Whatever the enemy, Cadavo is unsubtle in his subtlety and will exploit any possible trick to vex the enemy. His troops are veteran harriers and have learned from the best.

effects.description:
Enables Dirty Fighting attacks for melee infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Cadavo's usual bunch also tends to dispatch opponents as quickly as possible, since in a dangerous New World the least dangerous foe is a trained Elf. Or maybe they just like hurting stuff.

skillTree.localised_description: Mercenary hosts usually include powerful regiments with double pay and double the risks, once dubbed in Tilea "Duplicarii". The original meaning has gone lost, and the usual sense is now "You bunch of dog-botherers will better get it done, with what you cost me."

skillTree.localised_description: A commoner was once asked by a foreign recruiter about a band of Estalian mercenaries. Shrugging, he replied that they were "evil men", which was misunderstood as being 'local' for tough troops. Like many mistranslations, it stuck.

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

skillTree.localised_description: "You kill them before they kill you, sonnie. That's all it is."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Though of course, if they do stab you, you better know how to parry."

effects.description:
Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Plus, you better kill them dead with the one shot you have."

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "And to do that, it helps if you put all your weight where it counts."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +2% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Look, at the end of the day, you may be alive and you better learn from what didn't kill you."

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.

"Open the coffers, put up more signs. I want more cannons, pikes, even ogres, even those buggers with the paper wings. Everyone. I shall have that castle by tomorrow or by Myrmidia I will drown them in mercs."
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "I shall wear midnight... and many knives."

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
A commander that allows his captains and troops to everything they can put their hands on is either irresponsible, well-adviced, criminally aggressive or all of the above.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

skillTree.localised_description: Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.
